Tucson looks to the paintings thoughtfully.  

" Yes, I believe you're righ=
t Talon.  These depictions tell all.  And if this so called other deity is =
a physical being, then it must be evil, or else it wouldn't be painted in b=
lack.  And if it is a physical being, it must be stopped.  And I have a fee=
ling that perhaps its best if I face this being personally.   Now, let's se=
e...  This pictograph gives a location..  Ah, I got it, these paintings res=
emble a path that I happen to know rather well.  And some of this writing..=
 I think it means " Blight" .   Tucson to base, over.  I have identified an=
 enemy, via pictograph images found on my location.  The name of our new en=
emy is Blight, and by the look of the pictographs, he is a Predacon.    I w=
ill proceed to locate Blight now .  Or at least get him to heed my warning.=
  Tucson out."

He narrows his eyes, leaps up onto a large boulder and give=
s off his thunderous roar, hoping that Blight gets the message.

Local arti=
st who specializes in illustration, using traditional and digital media.  
=

I also specialize in hand made crafts.  Great for any occasion!  

Need a =
great gift idea that is original?  No problem!  Email me at this address an=
d we will talk.  

On Jun 21, 2012, at 5:08 PM, "C" <airly2002@...>=
 wrote:

> Talon:
> 
> talon ate the fish and looked athe paint and said "D=
o they think that you are actually a sort of deity as well as the other one=
?"
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Sandra Panico <magicquartz@...> wrot=
e:
> >
> > Tucson embraces Talon with his tail around her shoulders.
> > 
>=
 > " So will I. Talon, so will I. But that doesn't mean we can't try to rec=
reate a little portion of life on our own planet. This seed we were given, =
it needs soil, water, light and something to plant it in. Perhaps we can fi=
nd a place where there is an abundance of soil and take that with us. "
> >=
 
> > Just as he spoke, a Protohuman, carrying an offering of fish, kneels =
down before Tucson and Talon. Tucson looks to the offering. It was a most g=
enerous portion of fish. Yet now he could not eat it, but he knew Talon wou=
ld need nourishment. He nods gently to the Protohuman and accepts his offer=
ing with a gentile touch of his nose on the man's shoulder. He allows him t=
o stroke his snout as some sort of good luck ritual.  The man bows in graci=
ousness to Tucson's gesture of kindness and leaves him be with Talon.
> > 
=
> > " I'm not so sure what all of that meant but, whatever it was, it was a=
 very kind gesture on his part. I wonder if these people had any interactio=
n with the old Silver Dragon.. " 
> > 
> > It isn't long before others come=
 to offer more gifts to him and Talon. One of the Protohumans points to a p=
ainting on a rock, with white portraying silver, in a primitive image of a =
large reptile with outstretched wings.
> > 
> > " Oh, I see now.. Yes, they=
 have seen him before. To them he is a guardian, and the more offerings the=
y gave him, he would return their kind gestures by offering his protection.=
 But there is more to these paintings.. A strange mysterious figure, with a=
n aura around it.. To me it seems evil. Another idol, someone else to worsh=
ip. .. People portrayed in black and white.. White, meaning those who look =
to the Silver Dragon and black to those who worship the intimidating idol..=
 I've seen ancient pictographs before on Cybertron, and these are different=
 but in the same format. Talon if the dragon is a physical being, then this=
 dark idol must be as well. We need to find it, before it lays harm to anyo=
ne."
> > 
> > Local artist who specializes in illustration, using tradition=
al and digital media. 
> > 
> > I also specialize in hand made crafts. Grea=
t for any occasion! 
> > 
> > Need a great gift idea that is original? No p=
roblem! Email me at this address and we will talk.

2, at 3:57 AM, "C" <airly2002@...> wrote:
> > 
> > > Talon 
> > > 
> > > Th=
e femme smiled when she saw all those things and said softly "I will miss a=
ll this"
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Sandra Panico <magicqu=
artz@> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > With a gentile smile, Tucson returns the kiss=
 and holds his wing over them to provide a moment alone with Talon. After t=
he kiss he lowers his wing and notices that a collection of small creatures=
 surrounding him and Talon . Yet they do so in a fashion of admiration rath=
er than hostility. Tucson looks to them curiously.
> > > > 
> > > > " I'm n=
ot sure why these creatures are curious about us but it appears as if they'=
re here to admire rather than attack. I wonder... "
> > > > 
> > > > He sta=
nds up and gets back into beast mode, and sits down once more. The creature=
s draw closer to him and sit beside him and Talon. It was clear that the Si=
lver Dragon was a source of comfort to these creatures, but that was about =
to change once he and Talon left for Cybertron. It was a massive guilt slam=
med upon his heart. Yet how could he get the animals to understand that he =
had to leave them in such a short time? He was now their guardian and they =
were looking up to him for protection. 
> > > > 
> > > > " Talon, these cre=
atures remember the old dragon that sought to their protection and realize =
that I have taken his place. It's as I thought, they aren't aware of who we=
 really are, and where we are from. They will not understand that we must l=
eave them shortly, for good, and Primus knows what will happen to them once=
 we leave. ... Talon, I hear something coming. It's not a Predacon but it's=
 a fairly large creature."
> > > > 
> > > > Not far from them, Tucson spots=
 the scales of a rather large reptile, that appears to be fishing in the st=
ream next to them. He watches attentively and at that moment, the creature =
lifts its head. It was another dragon. Yet this one was a bit smaller than =
he was, but the same coloration. He takes note of its slender shape. It was=
 female. She looks to him as he looks to her. She slowly approaches him and=
 they look gently to each other like brother and sister. In draconic vocali=
zation, Tucson explains who he is and his dilemma. She intern rumbles back =
and bows her head. She nods as he does. It was their way of communicating a=
s Tucson looks back to Talon.
> > > > 
> > > > " Apparently the old dragon =
has family here. They are scattered but they exist. And she said that she w=
ill protect these creatures and this land along with her brethren for as lo=
ng as they live. And she wishes us good luck on our journey."
> > > > 
> > =
> > With that, the dragoness leaves them peacefully to enjoy their time tog=
ether. With a gentile groan, the creatures too, depart. It was truly a spir=
itual moment for both of them.

icquartz@> wrote:
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Tucson holds Talon gently with an=
 arm around her shoulders. He looks up and then back to her.
> > > > > > 
>=
 > > > > > " Like a branch on a tree that has broken off during a storm and=
 regrows in a different direction than it had been, before it had broken of=
f. I know exactly how you feel. I feel the same way. At one time, I was bli=
nd, rolled on four wheels and I always seemed to be an Autobot rebel. I fou=
ght along side with my comrades but I wasn't good at following orders. I wa=
s well grounded but lost at the same time. Then, I met you and things began=
 to change on a more positive note. You may not believe this, but you helpe=
d me to find my path, and you saw me on the right road and guided me to my =
true fate. Soon afterwards, I became a Prime, acquired seventeen more wheel=
s, and almost looked like Optimus Prime, yet different. But one thing didn'=
t change, I was still battling blindness off and on. Then, a third change, =
due to extensive damage to my previous form, which could not be repaired, I=
 was guided to my final evolution, this one. All of these things wouldn't h=
ave come about if I had never met you. And I wouldn't have it any other way=
. Talon, I will miss this planet as much as you are, and hopefully we can t=
ell our offspring all about this planet and it's wondrous varieties of life=
 that live here."
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > The rodent climbs down and drops=
 a nut into his hand, and chatters to him.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > " This =
is for us to keep? Thank you, we will take good care of it."
> > > > > > 
>=
 > > > > > He places the nut in Talon's hand.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > " I =
think we have a way to bring back a small reminder of this planet. Let's se=
e if we can encourage it to grow on ours."

ding to the old dragon's cave. But the path itself carries a serene atmosph=
ere as a gentile stream ripples over glistening river rocks while dragonfli=
es dodge the current of the water. And now, for the first time, Tucson coul=
d actually enjoy it visually as well as harmonically. 
> > > > > > > > > > =

> > > > > > > > > > " I've been this way once before, but I wanted to retu=
rn here when it was possible for both of us to enjoy it together. And now, =
we can. I can see why Leo is concerned, so much innocent life, too valuable=
 to destroy. The entire planet is a treasure within itself. And who better =
to enjoy this treasure than with you? No one. I only hope that after we lea=
ve, this world will remain as pure as it is now. But there's more that I wa=
nt to show you."
> > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > He takes Talon in=
to a forest of giant trees and points upward.
> > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > =
> > > > > > " If you sit under this tree and look straight up, it appears t=
o be reaching to the sky, yet it shades you from the heat of the sun. It pr=
ovides shelter and protection, yet it does so in an innocent manner. It's s=
omething Master Yoketron taught me, when he was my Sensai. See things with =
a different perspective and not always what everyone else sees. Here, I'll =
show you. "
> > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > He shows Talon to a bo=
ulder beneath a large hardwood tree and sits right under it,looking up.

> > > Not far from them, Tucson spots=
 the scales of a rather large reptile, that appears to be fishing in the st=
ream next to them. He watches attentively and at that moment, the creature =
lifts its head. It was another dragon. Yet this one was a bit smaller than =
he was, but the same coloration. He takes note of its slender shape. It was=
 female. She looks to him as he looks to her. She slowly approaches him and=
 they look gently to each other like brother and sister. In draconic vocali=
zation, Tucson explains who he is and his dilemma.  She intern rumbles back=
 and bows her head. She nods as he does. It was their way of communicating =
as Tucson looks back to Talon.<br>
> > > <br>
> > > " App=
arently the old dragon has family here. They are scattered but they exist. =
And she said that she will protect these creatures and this land along with=
 her brethren for as long as they live. And she wishes us good luck on our =
journey."<br>
> > > <br>
> > > With that, the dragoness l=
eaves them peacefully to enjoy their time together. With a gentile groan, t=
he creatures too, depart. It was truly a spiritual moment for both of them.=

> > > > > " Like a branch on a t=

 feel the same way. At one time, I was blind, rolled on four wheels and I a=
lways seemed to be an Autobot rebel. I fought along side with my comrades b=
ut I wasn't good at following orders. I was well grounded but lost at the s=
ame time. Then, I met you and things began to change on a more positive not=
e. You may not believe this, but you helped me to find my path, and you saw=
 me on the right road and guided me to my true fate. Soon afterwards, I bec=
ame a Prime, acquired seventeen more wheels, and almost looked like Optimus=
 Prime, yet different. But one thing didn't change, I was still battling bl=
indness off and on. Then, a third change, due to extensive damage to my pre=
vious form, which could not be repaired, I was guided to my final evolution=
, this one. All of these things wouldn't have come about if I had never met=
 you. And I wouldn't have it any other way. Talon, I will miss this planet =
as much as you are, and hopefully we can tell our offspring all about this =
planet and it's wondrous varieties of life that live here."<br>

a happy look on his face, Tucson walks with Talon, down the corridor and ou=
t to a walking trail which he had been down before but could not see. It wa=
s leading to the old dragon's cave. But the path itself carries a serene at=
mosphere as a gentile stream ripples over glistening river rocks while drag=
onflies dodge the current of the water. And now, for the first time, Tucson=
 could actually enjoy it visually as well as harmonically. <br>

ld will remain as pure as it is now. But there's more that I want to show y=
ou."<br>
